result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas T. Hutchison is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas T. Hutchison in court with attorney Erik McFarland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF16, 15CM8, 15TR19 and 15TR24.

9:09  a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF16:
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - Dismissed 

15CM8:
Count 1 - Dismissed 
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - DRI

15TR 24:
Count 1 - DRI

15TR19:
Count 1 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Atty Cousins relies on the BAC of .102 as part of the factual basis.
Court has reviewed the criminal complaint.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 15CF16 and Count 2 is dismissed; 15CM8 Count 1 is dismissed and Count's 2-4 are DRI; 15TR24 Count 1 is DRI and 15TR19 Count 1 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CF16:
Count 1 -
Imposed/Stayed 360 day jail sentence - with Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow; 2nd half to be done on home monitor
Placed on 24 months probation
Conditions of Probation:
180 days conditional jail - with Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow (possible care of mother)
Report to jail today to get start date
60 days to start jail sentence 
8 days pre-trial incarceration credit
Pay fine of $1,800 plus costs/surcharges - DNA Surcharge
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations; to be independant of DOT Assessment if Agent approves.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Maintain full-time employment.
Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended by the agent.
36 month DL Revocation
36 month IID on any vehicle owned or operated by the defendant

Count 2 - Dismissed

15CM8:
Count 1 - Dismissed
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - DRI

15TR 24:
Count 1 - DRI

15TR19:
Count 1 - DRI
15CM8 to cover bond also for file 15CF16

12/17/15: Bond amended to :   Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *One Time Per Week. All other conditions remain the same. /s/TBE
1/12/15:  Bond is amended to allow the defendant to post $300 to be released.  Sign a wage assignment for $50 per payperiod.  All other conditions remain the same:
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License and comply with conditions. 
15CM8 to cover bond also for file 15CF16

Defendant Nicholas T. Hutchison in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-16 and 15CM-8.

2:47 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

This matter was set before the Court for a motion hearing although the Court has not received any motion.

Atty Renc addresses the Court regarding motion hearing, excusing day report requirement as bond condition, for reasons stated on the record.

Court addresses the parties.

Atty Renc replies.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, has not had any additional contact with ATTIC, understands the nature of the request. Next hearing is set in less than one month. 

Matter is set for a plea in January.

Court questions Defendant as to sobriety.

BY THE COURT:
Court will drop the pretrial supervision requirement in the amended bond but Defendant to report to day report one day per week.
and Affidavit of Atty Redfield - granted
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
9:11 a.m. Defendant Nicholas T. Hutchison in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Redfield informs the Court he has filed a withdrawal of counsel as Defendant is eligible for public defender. BTC: Withdrawal Granted.
BTC: Defendant is ordered to go today to Public Defender.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas T. Hutchison in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF16, 15CM8, (State of Wisconsin) 15TR24 and 15TR19 (Portage County).

3:03 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.
Atty Redfield had filed a Motion for Probable Cause.
All parties are ready to proceed.
3:05 p.m.  Deputy Kevin Flick is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
Witness identifies the defendant.
Atty Redfield asks Atty Cousins to repeat the question; he does so.
3:07 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Refield.
3:09 p.m.  Witness is excused.
Atty Redfield would request the playing of the video.  
Court questions what video; Atty Redfield indicates would be the squad video.
Court questions Atty Redfield if he had requested prior to today's hearing that the equipment be set up for him to play this video (as not set up).
Atty Redfield makes statement.
Atty Cousins stipulates to the statement of Atty Redfield and what would be on the video; Atty Redfield is okay with this.
3:12 p.m.  Nicholas Thomas Hutchison is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Redfield.
Atty Cousins has not cross examination.
3:18 p.m.  Witness is excused.
Atty Redfield makes argument on his Motion.
Court requests clarification from Atty Redfield regarding 40 minutes over 40 seconds; Atty Redfield indicats should be 40 seconds.
3:22 p.m.  Atty Cousins makes argument on the Motion of Atty Redfield.
Court makes statement.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds the deputy's testimony credible and finds by a preponderance of the evidence that there was a traffic violation.
Atty Redfield's Motion is DENIED.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
for Probable Cause, Motion for Probable Cause, Affidavit of Jared Redfield

Defendant appears by video. Attorney Brandon Kuhl in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the Portage County.
All files heard: 15CM8, 15TR19, 15TR24

Court has lost the visual on the video at this time.  Parties do not object to proceeding without the visual. 

15CM8 -
Attorney Kuhl received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court questions Atty Cousins re: blood draw. 

NOT GUILTY pleas entered.

Court is reluctant to modify the bond since this is an OWI 4th offense.

Atty Kuhl responds.

Initial appearance on January 12, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Nicholas T. Hutchison not in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CM-8, 15TR-19 and 15TR-24.

9:08 AM Court calls cases.
Defendant has failed to appear.

Court reviews the files.

Court will continue that citation until Feb 2nd at 8:30 am.

15TR-19, notice of intent to revoke.
10 day period has not yet run.
Court will set this for 2-2 at 8:30 am as well.

State requests a warrant in 15CM-8.

Court reviews the file.
Cash bond was not posted, Defendant may still be in custody.

BY THE COURT:
All three of these cases will be re-called at 1:15 today.
